title: Homes on the Cornish Coast
description: Sales have rebounded since 2008, though prices in this part of southern England are still around 15 percent below precrash levels.

title: House Hunting on ... the Cornish Coast
description: A RENOVATED 19th-CENTURY BARN NEAR ROCK

title: Diapers That Give T.M.I.
description: Too much information.

title: 60 Seconds With Pogue: High-Tech Glasses
description: The Timess David Pogue on how technology is changing our experience with low-tech items, such as eyeglasses.

title: Diverging Debate at Fed on When to End Stimulus
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve Chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, said on Wednesday that the Fed was likely to extend the centerpiece of its campaign to bolster the economy  keeping short-term interest rates close to zero  even as it prepares to wind down another key stimulus program that faces mounting internal opposition.

title: High-Tech Eyeglasses, Not Made by Google
description: If someone mentions the phrase high-tech glasses, you probably assume that person is talking about Google Glass, the smartphone-on-a-headband that Google hopes to offer for sale next year.

title: Were Having a Pink Wave
description: Is pink the official color of summer? Tables at street cafes are peppered with glasses of blush-colored ros (is it more popular than ever?), cheeks are flushed from the heat (and maybe the wine), and at the European fashion shows just ended, a slew of stylish showgoers worked pink shades into their looks. At the mens shows, the blogger Linda Tol wore a raw-edged pink maxidress with a matching camera case, no less; and the model Jamie Bochert wore a grungy pink Saint Laurent cardigan to the SL show. At couture, the stylist Natalia Alaverdian was quirky in her boxy pink jacket and dangling earrings; Jennifer Lawrence was daring in a cropped pink lace top from the Dior resort collection; and Natalia Vodianova was terribly correct in pink Chanel. And doesnt the pale pink bag carried by Leighton Meester, in Los Angeles for a premiere, look fresh? As these pack leaders prove, a little pink, styled in nuanced ways, is just the right amount of sweet.

title: Chinas Growth Woes Could Force Government Response
description: This week, China enters the sanfu days of the lunar calendar, similar to what are known in the west as the dog days of summer. Some areas of the country are battling huge floods, and the weather will most likely get worse before it gets better.

title: Player Ratings: United States (6) vs. Belize (1)
description: The United States cruised to an easy win over Belize on Tuesday night in Portland to open its 2013 Gold Cup campaign with three points.

title: Audience Enters a Sightless World, Where Listening Becomes a Lifeline
description: Breaking down the ingrained resistance an audience often brings to a challenging new work can be a good thing. Even if it means making people uncomfortable.

title: Rift Among Democrats Stalls Effort to Reverse Rise in College Loan Rates
description: WASHINGTON  A bipartisan Senate coalition on Wednesday blocked a Democratic proposal to retroactively cut interest rates on higher education loans in half, leaving any student loan rescue in doubt and laying bare divisions among Democrats about how to resolve the dispute.

title: Senators Question Chinese Takeover of Smithfield
description: WASHINGTON  Members of the Senate Agriculture Committee raised questions on Wednesday about the economic and national security implications of a Chinese companys proposed acquisition of Smithfield Foods, the nations largest pork producer.

title: A Travel Boom in Myanmar
description: Myanmar, once among the more isolated countries in the world, is in the midst of an epic tourism boom, with the number of annual visitors expected to multiply seven times by 2020 to 7.5 million people per year. That kind of splashy growth is getting high-end travel companies to take notice.

title: Why Italy Could Be Fertile Ground for Deal Makers
description: Overseas buyers should look again at Italy. It is hardly surprising that deal-making is slow east of the Alps. But Italian firms excel in fields from fashion to engineering. The countrys parlous state is not an insurmountable obstacle to foreign investment. Foreigners just need to find ways to coax Italys aging entrepreneur-owners to the table.

title: A Pop-Up Shop in Honor of Bastille Day
description: Fleur du Mal, the lingerie and ready-to-wear label from Jennifer Zuccarini, a founder of Kiki de Montparnasse, is going all out to celebrate Bastille Day. For two weeks, starting July 10, the company will honor the French national day with a pop-up shop inside Clic Gallery in SoHo. Among the treats youll find there are these flirty lace bits (bra, $148; high-waist panties; $138, and bodysuit, $295); chic striped knit underpinnings, $120 to $145; and a ruffled white lace jumpsuit, $1,250  not to mention custom tulle panties embroidered with Eiffel Towers and phrases like plat du jour by LQQK Studio in Brooklyn. There is also jewelry from the Parisian designer Yazbukey and vintage goods, including Jane Birkin records and French photography magazines. Francophiles and lingerie nuts: this one is for you. Check the Web site, fleurdumal.com, for news of special events at the pop-up.

title: When Love Goes Awry, Turn Pain Into Songs
description: Steve Kazee is a far more complicated musical personality than Guy, the ingenuous Irish busker he portrayed in the Broadway musical Once. Bitter, tormented, and ruthlessly self-scrutinizing, he comes across on a nightclub stage as a performer struggling against insecurity.

title: Pitcher Who Stayed in Japan Doesnt Stay on Mound
description: SAPPORO, Japan  The showdown in June was brief and had little influence on the game, but it spoke volumes about one of the biggest stars to emerge in Japanese baseball in years.

title: Froome Loses Time Trial but Not His Yellow Jersey
description: MONT SAINT-MICHEL, France  When he mounted an attack on the final climb of Stage 8 on Saturday, a move that gave him a commanding lead in the Tour de France, many of Christopher Froomes rivals were caught by surprise. It was too early in the three-week race, they thought, to take the yellow jersey.

title: Ronni Kappos Turns Vintage Glass Into Jewelry
description: The latest collection from the Los Angeles jeweler I. Ronni Kappos is handmade from a cache of vintage German glass edged with 24-karat gold, which she fashions into clean, modern shapes with summery bursts of color. These aqua and coral double drop earrings, $127, would be a great accent for a white beach dress, a striped work dress or a tank and jeans shorts. Think of them as an easy way to spruce up without breaking the bank.

title: New Play by Pulitzer Winner To Be Part of LCT3 Season
description: Ayad Akhtar, whose Disgraced won this years Pulitzer Prize for drama, will be back at Lincoln Center Theater next year with a new offering, The Who and the What. Scheduled for the spring, the play is part of LCT3, a programming initiative aimed at introducing newer artists, and which presented Disgraced as well.

title: Fantasy Football: Sleeper and Breakout Candidates at Running Back
description: Players often emerge from under the radar to become key contributors on fantasy football rosters, especially at running back. Whether a player is returning from an injury or outshining the competition in a running-back-by-committee, it happens every season.

title: Adventures Abroad Could Hurt U.S. Companies
description: Carson C. Block is the director of research for Muddy Waters, an investment firm.

title: A Game That Deals in Personal Data
description: All kinds of companies and services  social networks, data brokers, loyalty card programs to name just a few  amass and analyze details about millions of consumers activities and preferences. But the inner workings of this surveillance economy remain largely opaque to the public despite the recent revelations of widespread government data-mining of peoples phone and e-mail records.

title: Mos Def Video Puts Force-Feeding in Spotlight
description: In an online video this week, the rapper and actor Yasiin Bey, also known as Mos Def, is shown in a baggy orange prison uniform with shackles around his wrists and ankles, and strapped into a medical chair.

title: More Signs of Peak Us in New Study of Peak Oil Demand
description: Back in 2010, I asked this question: Which Comes First  Peak Everything or Peak Us? My focus was whether humans could use the gift of foresight to curb resource appetites in ways that would avoid having the peak imposed on us by shortages or human-induced environmental shifts like climate disruption.

title: Etnia Barcelona Gives its Aviator Sunglasses Flight Numbers
description: The Paris-Tokyo line of sunglasses from the creative young Spanish label Etnia Barcelona comes in cool color combos, each style named for the flight number of an airline the serves the Paris-Tokyo route. The JL406, for a Japan Airlines flight (above), is a Wayfarer shape with rocker appeal. Another, the rounded AF280, for Air France, is a 1960s shape, inspired by Yoko Ono. The glasses have acetate frames and photochromic lenses that darken in sunlight. And with the contrast colors on the brow line, theyre a fun midsummer pick-me-up.

title: Nets Are Optimistic and Expensive
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The names slipped out before Billy King could catch himself. Kevin, he said in passing. Paul, he said in his next breath. All he could do was smile a wry smile and move on.

title: In Clinton Hill, a High Tolerance for Hammering
description: Five years ago, with the help of his parents, Brett Masterson bought a fixer-upper in Roxbury, Mass. The price was in the high $300,000s.

title: Pilots Delayed Evacuation to Talk to Tower, Official Says
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When the battered Asiana Boeing 777 skidded to a stop after its crash-landing here on Saturday, two flight attendants went to the cockpit to ask the three pilots inside what to do, and the pilots told them to delay evacuating the airplane while they communicated with the tower, the chairwoman of the National Transportation Safety Board said on Wednesday.

title: De Blasio Arrested, Just as He Wanted
description: Bill de Blasio, a candidate for mayor, was slapped into plastic cuffs on Wednesday and driven off in a white police van from outside the Midtown Manhattan offices of the State University of New York chancellor, where Mr. de Blasio led a demonstration against the possible closing of Long Island College Hospital in Brooklyn.

title: J. Cole Reaches No.1, Finally
description: These days, if an album makes it to No. 1, it usually does so right out of the gate. When one reaches the top after having started lower down the chart, it is often because the album has held strong against its competition, or because sales have sunk all around. In the case of J. Coles Born Sinner (Roc Nation/Columbia), both scenarios apply.

title: Public Opinion Shifts on Security-Liberty Balance
description: A new Quinnipiac poll has found a significant shift in public opinion on the trade-off between civil liberties and national security. In the new survey, released on Wednesday, 45 percent of the public said they thought the governments antiterrorism policies have gone too far in restricting the average persons civil liberties  as compared with 40 percent who said they have not gone far enough to adequately protect the country.

title: New Shops and Sales for the Week of July 11
description: Openings

title: What Is Bank Capital, Anyway?
description: Regulators are butting heads with banks this week over capital, with new rules on the table that could force banks to hold more of it. But what exactly is capital, and why is it so important?

title: Working Parents, Wanting Fewer Hours
description: On Monday I wrote an article (the first in a series about work-life balance) profiling a middle-class working mother who persuaded her employer to give her a more flexible schedule. Ive gotten a lot of questions about why the article focused on mothers and not fathers.

title: Young Immigrants Stage Citizenship Ceremony at the Capitol
description: WASHINGTON  Four hundred young immigrants gathered near the Capitol on Wednesday to hold their own version of a citizenship ceremony, kicking off a nationwide campaign to push legislation through the House of Representatives that would offer eventual citizenship to millions of undocumented immigrants.

title: Three Goddesses, One Golden Apple. Do the Math.
description: Sometimes losing is temporary. In 1955, Judy Garland may have had the Best Actress Oscar stolen from her by Grace Kelly for The Country Girl, but Garlands performance, in A Star is Born, is the one that has endured.

title: Artful Defense at 6th European Open in Belgium
description: Zia Mahmood was the third United States medal winner at the 6th European Open Championships in Ostend, Belgium, last month. He finished second in the open pairs with Jan Jansma from the Netherlands. (The two United States winners were Janice Seamon-Molson in the womens pairs with Catherine dOvidio from France, and Roy Welland in the open pairs with Sabine Auken from Germany.)

title: Whats Wrong With a 20-Week Abortion Ban?
description: The Texas House today passed the abortion restriction bill that State Senator Wendy Davis derailed last month.

title: S.E.C. Lifts Advertising Ban on Private Investments
description: Federal regulators on Wednesday lifted an 80-year-old ban on advertising by hedge funds, buyout firms and start-up companies seeking capital, a move that will fundamentally change the way that many issuers raise money in the private marketplace.

title: Romantic Blades of Grass Get a Toe Touch of Baroque at River to River
description: The setup of The Set Up, an eight-part project by the choreographers Wally Cardona and Jennifer Lacey, involves their consulting with dance artists considered to be masters of a particular form. Much as these exchanges pull the choreographers into foreign territory  Okinawan folk dance, Cambodian classical dance  the works that result pull the forms out of their cultural context.

title: Pedal Pushers
description: Riders seek fashionable shoes to go with New York Citys bike-sharing program.

title: Intrigue Behind Bars: More Gossip Girl Than Oz
description: First with Weeds and now with Orange Is the New Black, the television writer and producer Jenji Kohan has proved herself the master of an odd but successful narrative ploy: putting well-behaved middle-class white women in the middle of stories that typically feature rough nonwhite men.

title: iExit: No Directions, but Much Guidance
description: You may be familiar with the two-screen experience through TV, where viewers are encouraged to use a computer, phone or tablet during a show to see video extras.

title: New York Gun Rights Group Plans Freedompalooza
description: ALBANY  Hoping to find support and money among country music fans, a group of gun rights supporters and other grass-roots organizations in New York have announced a new addition to the summer festival circuit: Freedompalooza.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Instagrams From the T.S.A., and Facebook Father
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. More Scuttlebot can be found here.

title: The Nerd Is Rich Yet Still at a Loss
description: If only all social misfits were as stealthily charming as Eric Muller, the nerdy narrator of Gabriel Roths sparkling debut novel. If Eric means to make himself sound unappealing to the reader, he fails miserably in his mission. Who could resist the kind of tech-oriented guy who calculates his exact reasons for arriving at a party at 10:32 p.m., because at that relatively early stage its possible to imagine that this party will live up to the promise inherent in the notion of a party? Or who would notice, a little later, that the population has increased, but not to the Malthusian degree it would take to make the party memorable?

title: Bombing Kills Top Security Aide to Pakistan President
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  President Asif Ali Zardaris chief security officer was killed in a bombing in the port city of Karachi on Wednesday, raising concerns about the vulnerability of even senior officials to attack by militants.

title: Ciara, Not Quite at the Center of Her Newest Album
description: Ciara sings as if singing were dancing. She stretches syllables out into long arcs. She accelerates and then decelerates. Shes almost never staccato, moving fluidly from one word into the next and then through.

title: Former South Korean Spy Chief Charged With Bribery
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A former national intelligence chief of South Korea was arrested on bribery charges on Wednesday, further tarnishing the image of the countrys spy agency, which has already been accused of meddling in the presidential election in December.

title: Pictures of the Day: Bosnia and Herzegovina and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Bosnia and Herzegovina, China, Indonesia and Spain.

title: AIDS in New York: Being Alive Was Beyond Belief for Some
description: As he entered the second-floor gallery at the New-York Historical Society on a hot summer afternoon, Florent Morellet paused, closely studying the timeline that started the museums current exhibition, AIDS in New York: The First Five Years. As he stood there, dressed boyishly in shorts and Converse sneakers, Mr. Morellet silently ticked off such time-defining moments as the initial meeting of the Gay Mens Health Crisis in 1982 and the Food and Drug Administrations approval of an antibody test to detect H.I.V. in 1985.

title: At Sentencing, Victim Describes Rape and Its Aftermath
description: As the hulking stranger held her down by the throat and sexually assaulted her, the young woman stopped thinking about being rescued, about breaking free, or even about surviving.

title: Bicycle Helmets as Fashion Statements
description: Unlike motorcycle helmets, bicycle helmets have historically had zero cool factor on city streets.

title: Cameron Russell, a Model, Puts Looks Aside
description: Cameron Russell, like most fashion models, knows how to pose for the camera, a skill she demonstrated on a recent Friday at the Brooklyn studio of her media consulting company.

title: The Immigration Battle Explained
description: With Congress back in session and expected to address immigration, the question is whether members of the House will take up the Senates bill, or go their own way.

title: Wait, Mermaids Live How Long?
description: We all hate that its her 15th birthday. . . . Its like, who gets married at 15? Why cant she be at least 18 or 20? None of us are 15 anymore.

title: A Guide to Personal Weather Stations
description: Have you ever checked the local weather report and been told it was sunny out when rain was pelting your window? Theres a reason for that: weather updates depend on the location of the monitoring equipment, often at airports, where conditions can be quite different from where you are.

title: Looking Smart on the Pedals
description: On a recent afternoon, Jocelyn Steiber zipped across Prince Street on a bright blue Citi Bike: blond hair loose, floral print Ella Moss sundress parachuting like Marilyn Monroe.

title: Bike Helmets as Style Statements
description: As more pedestrians take to the pedals, it was perhaps inevitable that the helmet evolve from hair-flattening safety necessity to accessory.

title: Suitable Boy Author Renegotiating $1.7 Million Contract After Unsuitable Delay
description: Vikram Seth, the author of the 1,300-plus page doorstop of a novel A Suitable Boy, is in negotiations with his London publisher over his failure to deliver the manuscript of a sequel on time for release this fall.

title: When Hippies Walked the Runways
description: FINALLY, AN ANSWER to one of fashions most puzzling riddles may be within reach: Who was more stylish, punks or hippies?

title: Tip of the Week: Test-Drive Android Apps Online
description: Want to preview a mobile app on your Amazon Kindle Fire or other Android device before you install the software? Thousands of programs in the Amazon Appstore for Android include a Test Drive feature that lets you fire up a version the app in your browser window to try before you buy.

title: 8 Strings, More Hands
description: Paola Prestini is probably best known as a composer, but her business card might more accurately read human resources alchemist, such is her gift for bringing together disparate artists, technicians and other creative professionals to produce cross-disciplinary works greater than the sum of their parts. As the guiding force of VisionIntoArt, a collective she helped to found in 1999, she has facilitated flamboyant, confounding and enticing collaborations among choreographers, visual artists, actors and composers, including her own well-traveled Oceanic Verses.

title: Federal Reserves Easing of Stimulus Could Hamper a European Recovery
description: VLOTHO, Germany  The European economy has many problems. One is out of the regions control: the United States Federal Reserve.

title: State Regulations for Abortion Clinics
description: Apart from limiting the timing of abortions, many states are imposing new regulations on abortion facilities and doctors. Proponents of the laws say the rules will make abortions safer. But clinic directors and professional societies say that many of the laws have no medical value and are intended to raise costs or force clinics to close.

title: Summer Facial Cleansers
description: Sweat and sunblock have us looking for supercharged facial cleansers. Below, four new choices.

title: All Lenses Turn to Sweden
description: Forget Kate. Now that the Duchess of Cambridge is about to enter the largely private state of doting motherhood (the word out of London is that the birth of her and Prince Williams first child is expected this weekend), the royals-obsessed European press needs someone else to focus on.

title: Apps for Digital Note-Taking
description: Years before Steve Jobs introduced the iPad to the world, tablet computers made regular appearances in science fiction shows. Fans of Star Trek will remember ensigns tapping on digital tablets or asking an officer to scribble a signature on one. Lots of those fictional machines had one thing in common: they worked with some sort of stylus and were digital equivalents of a traditional notepad.

title: Attaboy on the Lower East Side
description: When Milk & Honey closed on New Years Eve 2012, disciples of the neo-speakeasy were left without a place of worship. No longer. In March, two longstanding bartenders from Milk & Honey  Sam Ross and Michael McIlroy (tending bar above)  rechristened the bar as Attaboy.

title: Not Going Gentle Into That Good Night
description: Susanne Bartsch frowned into a ceiling-high mirror, lifting her left breast with her palm. This one looks droopy, she said, in her Swiss-German accent. She turned and examined her svelte profile, adding proudly, Theyre only a year old.

title: Theatrics and Acrobatics Commingle
description: Pilobolus, long a popular institution, is now 42. The publicity for the companys current New York season says it wouldnt be summer without Pilobolus at the Joyce Theater. Sure enough, on Tuesdays opening night the Joyce audience stood to cheer through the curtain calls. At this rate, who knows? Pilobolus may be with us for another 42 years. This is an amazement to those of us who loved the first generation of Pilobolus in the 1970s. It was popular then, too. But it didnt feel like an enduring institution. It was its own species, and seemed set to be fabulously ephemeral.

title: Yankees Cutoff Man in the Booth
description: In which the Yankees radio personality Suzyn Waldman again finds herself trapped in a Fenway Park broadcasting booth with the announcer John Sterling, Broadway musical fan and proud creator of distinctive home run calls.

title: Young, Ecstatic and on the Cusp
description: PURCHASE, N.Y.  Many countries have excellent national youth orchestras. The most famous in recent years, the Simn Bolvar Youth Orchestra of Venezuela, graduated to become the full-fledged, internationally known Simn Bolvar Symphony Orchestra.

title: Lions and Tigers and Bears! Oh My!
description: In Russia, land of the risk taker, circuses routinely allow children to have their picture taken with dangerous animals.

title: A Masculine Silhouette, Tailored for Her
description: Mary Going, 46, a former nonprofit consultant in Oakland, Calif., wanted to wear a suit to her same-sex wedding in 2008, but found the shopping process demoralizing.

title: Hes Acting Out; Its on Purpose
description: Its inevitable that well have to get to a definition of ratchet, so lets dispense with it quickly. To act ratchet is to act foolish, or trashy, to behave in a way that makes others shield their eyes. It is the opposite of decorous. There are plenty of places one can act ratchet  in the club, in the bedroom  but its always about behavior thats dubious at best, that makes people point fingers in slack-jawed astonishment and discomfort.

title: Manipulating Perverse Love
description: A distant world of ceremony, secrets and furtive sexual desire is conjured with shadow-strewn grace in Shun-kin, the latest production from Complicite and the director Simon McBurney. An adaptation of a 1933 short story by Junichiro Tanizaki, the production blends puppetry, traditional performance, music and design with the combination of daring and delicacy that Complicite has become known for in its previous visits to the Lincoln Center Festival.

title: Antiquity Exhibit at Cleveland Museum Is Canceled
description: A traveling exhibition of ancient treasures from Sicily that was scheduled to open at the Cleveland Museum of Art in September was canceled on Wednesday after officials from the Italian island complained that the art loan was hurting its economy, The Plain Dealer in Cleveland, Ohio, reported.

title: Step Right Up, Kids, the Predator Is Ready
description: MOSCOW  The father knelt beside his hesitant daughter and gently encouraged her to set aside her fears and take a seat.

title: New York Public Library Is Sued Over Book Plan
description: A group of prominent writers and scholars filed a lawsuit on Wednesday to stop the New York Public Library from demolishing the stacks in its flagship 42nd Street building or moving any books off the site. The complaint, filed in New York State Supreme Court, formalizes concerns about the Central Library Plan, which would replace the stacks with a circulating library and is expected to cost at least $300 million.

title: Penthouse Views, No Elevator
description: Urban birdhouses with modern amenities like green roofs and solar-powered porch lights.

title: Birdhouses With Street Cred, Courtesy of XAM
description: One sunny afternoon last month, an artist who describes himself as an architect for the contemporary bird appeared before an empty storefront in SoHo, climbed a telescoping ladder and took measurements for what would be his next finch-size masterwork.

title: Rubbing Out the Footprints
description: A Washington executive finds himself overtaken by the open land and beautiful water in Virginias Northern Neck.

title: Chesapeake Bay Pearl
description: There are places that immediately feel sacred: something about the air, the view, the way the landscape resonates with your soul.

title: Shopping for Armchairs
description: For Neal Beckstedt, an interior designer, the right armchair can give personality to a room.

title: Armchairs With Big Personalities
description: For Neal Beckstedt, designing a room often begins with an armchair.

title: Is There an Inexpensive Way to Freshen Up a Kitchen for a Sale?
description: Q. My kitchen looks tired. Is there an inexpensive way to freshen it up for a sale without a full renovation?

title: Depressed Mothers More Likely to Have Overweight Children, Study Finds
description: Mothers who report symptoms of depression are more likely to display obesity-promoting practices and have children who are overweight or obese than mothers who say they are not depressed, according to a new study.

title: Making Art, Sneaking Bacon
description: It was raining lightly on the Colony the other day. Thats the name of the temporary art camp set up in the courtyard of MoMA PS1 in Long Island City, Queens. The campers stayed dry, thanks to the silvery sunscreen curtains donated by a French company that hung atmospherically over the makeshift campsite put together by a77, an Argentine architectural firm. There were trailers and tents, a solar shower, a hydroponic garden and a kitchen presided over by Anne Apparu, a chef and food-performance artist originally from Corsica. She is a former roommate of Jenny Schlenzka, an associate curator at PS1 and one of the organizers of Expo 1: New York, an extended art happening exploring the planets environmental challenges.

title: Lenovo Is Top Supplier as Global PC Sales Fall
description: Move over, Hewlett-Packard. Youve just lost pride of place in an increasingly dubious tech category.

title: Curves Ahead, Alpaca Crossing
description: When the San Francisco-based interior designer Jiun Ho met Sandra Jordan at a design event in 2008, kindred spirits collided. The Malaysian-born Mr. Ho makes minimalist furniture inspired by his global travels. Ms. Jordan, the Peruvian-born daughter of a diplomat, heads a company that distributes luxury alpaca textiles. The result is the Jiun Ho IV Collection, 13 pieces inspired by the designers journeys in South America and upholstered in Ms. Jordans fabrics.

title: The Chao Pound
description: Guests are always welcome at Stephen Chaos family complex in Santa Monica, Calif.

title: They Shoot Potatoes, Dont They?
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  It was a typical weekend at the Chao Pound, to use the name Stephen Chao, the former television executive and National Enquirer reporter, has given to the six little 1920s Sears kit houses (plus barn) that he and his girlfriend, Rachel Mansur, a handbag impresario, call home.

title: Connect the Blocks
description: R. Buckminster Fuller coined the term tensegrity, for tensional integrity, a construction principle that led to a popular toy. Similarly, Dror Benshetrit, the designer of the Peacock chair from Cappellini, came up with a new truss that doubles as a diversion: four pieces of any material (like wood, metal or plastic) and four connectors of any kind (like screws, pegs or glue) that fold flat but open up to create four triangles. The QuaDror system of blocks is devilishly difficult to explain but easy to use; so easy, that prototypes disappeared. Thus was born a toy. Donald Rattner, the owner of the Module R art and design shop in Brooklyn, was strolling the International Gift Fair in New York in January and found the QuaDror blocks. The set ($36) consists of 10 trusses that can be assembled into anything in a childs (or adults) imagination. Module R is at 141 Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn. Information: (877) 360-3660 or module-r.com.

title: Pillows, Linens and More
description: From Thursday to July 18, Michele Varian is taking up to 50 percent off decorative pillows (a 22-inch-square Ultrasuede appliqu Suzani pinwheel pillow in cardinal, usually $370, is $185); 27 Howard Street (Crosby Street), (212) 343-0033, michelevarian.com.

title: The Shark Sonic Duo Restores Tired Rugs and Floors. No, Really.
description: A couple of red flags made me wary of the Shark Sonic Duo ($249.99), a machine that cleans carpets and hard floors. First were the self-important capitalized references on its Web site to Sonic Trap and Remove Technology and Airglide Maneuverability. Then there were the ominous words As Seen on TV.

title: 1950s: Building the American Dream at the Ohio History Center
description: For a prefab dwelling made of porcelain-enamel steel and sold to Americans after World War II as a cheap housing solution, the Lustron has become quite celebrated. In 2008, a Lustron home was erected inside the Museum of Modern Art for a show on factory-produced architecture. Now, the same home is the star attraction of 1950s: Building the American Dream, an exhibition at the Ohio History Center in Columbus.

title: The SoHo Digs of the Restaurateur Luke Ostrom
description: In his restaurants and at home, Luke Ostrom exudes a style that is both practical and chic. The New York chef-turned-restaurateur (Locanda Verde, the Dutch and the just-opened Lafayette) Ostrom, 35, lives simply. I love focused, clean design, he said, but more than anything, I like a utilitarian connection to what I collect, whether its vintage, industrial or modern.

title: Quick Route From Juilliard to Jail
description: Growing up in South Carolina, the daughter of a minister and a deacon, Danielle Brooks never planned on a stint in federal prison. In middle school, she visited a juvenile justice complex. They gave us a tour of the jail, Ms. Brooks recalled. The handcuffs, the walking in a straight line, the smell. I was like: This is totally not a place for me.

title: China and Russia, in a Display of Unity, Hold Naval Exercises
description: BEIJING  An armada of Chinese and Russian warships sailed in ceremonial formation in the Sea of Japan, off the port of Vladivostok, on Wednesday in what was the high point of joint naval exercises intended to show the growing unity between two countries with a historically uneasy relationship.

title: Egyptian Journalist Was Killed by Army Sniper He Filmed, Family Says
description: As The Lede reported on Monday, one of the most widely viewed images of the clashes in Cairo that morning, which left more than 50 dead, was a harrowing snippet of video that appeared to show an army sniper firing down at Islamist protesters from a rooftop, before turning his gun to take aim at the camera.

title: Neighborhood Joint: Kesso Foods
description: Kesso Foods is not the largest maker of Greek yogurt in New York, but that doesnt trouble the customers who come to its little shop in East Elmhurst, Queens.

title: At Sun Valley, Conspicuous by His Absence
description: SUN VALLEY, Idaho  Despite a flurry of attention over the deal makers at the Allen & Company media and technology conference here  Rupert Murdoch! John C. Malone! Robert Iger!  one of the most-mentioned individuals isnt here.

title: Japanese Nuclear Plant May Have Been Leaking for Two Years
description: TOKYO  The stricken nuclear power plant at Fukushima has probably been leaking contaminated water into the ocean for two years, ever since an earthquake and tsunami badly damaged the plant, Japans chief nuclear regulator said on Wednesday.

title: Greek Yogurt, by the Tangy Tub or Bucket
description: When Fotini Kessissoglou opened Kesso Foods, a pint-size Greek yogurt factory and shop in East Elmhurst, Queens, in 1986, she had no way of knowing that her countrys ultrathick, strained staple would someday become an American obsession.

title: Study Finds Benefits in Delaying Severing of Umbilical Cord
description: In most hospital delivery rooms, doctors routinely clamp and sever the umbilical cord less than a minute after an infants birth, a practice thought to reduce the risk of maternal hemorrhaging.

title: In Managing Harveys Innings, the Mets Make an All-Star Allowance
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Ensuring a young pitchers vitality remains an inexact science. When the Mets decided this week that Matt Harvey, their best pitcher, would not make his final scheduled start before the All-Star break, the move seemed to raise as many questions as it answered. Organizational impulses seemed placed at odds.

title: Tightening Siege by Syrian Rebels Stirs Anger
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrian rebels have tightened their siege on government-held districts in the divided city of Aleppo, choking supply lines and depleting staple foods at the onset of the Muslim holy month of Ramadan, traditionally a time of festive meals to break the daily fast.

title: Some Trees Use Less Water Amid Rising Carbon Dioxide, Paper Says
description: The fate of the worlds forests on a warming planet has long been one of the great unanswered questions about climate change. Now, new research is complicating the picture further, suggesting that big shifts are already under way in how forests work.

title: With Street-Hail Service Set to Expand, Some Drivers Are Skeptical
description: The sedans in black, silver, and navy waited along the curb for a signal: a look, a slight nod, an impatient rap on the window.

title: Promotions Celebrate Those Willing to Just Get Up and Go
description: WHILE not generally appreciated by bankers or crossing guards, impulsiveness is highly valued by marketers, who encourage spur-of-the-moment purchases. And separate stunts this week by Heineken and Hilton Worldwide are rewarding consumers for spontaneity with far-flung trips  but only if they depart with little or no forethought.

title: Taliban Spokesman Is Ousted for Creating Mistrust
description: LONDON  For years, the spokesman for Pakistans Taliban has claimed responsibility for suicide bombings, kidnappings and shootings of schoolgirls and tourists, without a murmur of censure from his bosses.

title: Deaths Climb From Disaster in Quebec
description: OTTAWA  The death toll in the fiery derailment of a train in a Quebec town over the weekend rose Wednesday, with the police reporting that the remains of 20 people had been found. The police also said that 30 more people were still missing, and it is widely assumed that they are dead.

title: Hopes Rise for Appeal of Ex-Marine Held in Iran
description: Prison life has markedly improved in recent weeks for Amir Hekmati, the former Marine incarcerated for nearly two years in Iran on spying accusations. His sister said he was now allowed weekly visits from three Iranian relatives, books, daily exercise and a regular correspondence of letters with family in the United States.

title: Serving Two Life Terms, Mob Boss Who Became Informer Wins Release
description: When Joseph C. Massino took the witness stand in 2011, becoming the first official boss of one of New Yorks five crime families to break the code of silence and testify against a former confederate, he offered a succinct explanation for his departure from mob tradition.

title: My Life, Post Exposure
description: I grew up in a Modern Orthodox Jewish family in New Jersey, where my sex talk, at 13, came in the form of my mother handing me a book of anatomical comics. Inside it, she placed post-it notes to indicate her feelings. In the masturbation section: God does not approve of this. In the gay sex section: Definitely not.

title: Hunger Strike by California Inmates, Already Large, Is Expected to Be Long
description: LOS ANGELES  Nearly 29,000 inmates in California state prisons refused meals for the third day Wednesday during a protest of prison conditions and rules. The protest extended to two-thirds of the 33 prisons across the state and all 4 private out-of-state facilities where California sends inmates, corrections officials said.

title: Israel Reopens Inquiry Into Activists Injury
description: The Israeli police on Wednesday agreed to re-investigate the 2009 injury of an American activist during a clash between Israeli security forces and protesters against the extension of Israels separation barrier in the West Bank. The activist, Tristan Anderson of Oakland, Calif., then 38, was hit in the head by a tear-gas canister in the village of Nilin, and remains partly paralyzed and blind in one eye. Yesh Din, an Israeli human rights organization, appealed to Israels High Court of Justice after the police closed the investigation without indicting any of the soldiers involved, and the courts justices urged the police to reopen the case.

title: North Korea Repeats Call for Talks
description: A senior North Korean diplomat said Wednesday that his country was willing to have any kind of talks to ease tensions on the Korean Peninsula, while at the same time repeating its call for the United States to dismantle its military command in South Korea. In the second news conference on the subject staged by the Norths senior diplomats in less than three weeks, So Se-pyong, North Koreas ambassador to the United Nations in Geneva, called for the dissolution of the United Nations military command led by the United States as a prerequisite for calming the situation on the peninsula. The alliance is called the United Nations Command, although the United Nations plays no role. If the United States made a bold decision on the issue, the North would also be in favor of taking confidence-building measures, Mr. So said, setting out the same case presented by North Koreas ambassador to the United Nations in New York last month.

title: D.C. Council Passes Wage Bill Despite Wal-Marts Threats
description: Even in urban areas where Wal-Mart has faced stiff opposition, little has slowed its expansion. But the City Council in the District of Columbia is trying to do so, as its passage of a bill that would require the worlds largest retailer to pay a starting wage that is several dollars above the citys minimum on Wednesday showed.

title: Sudden Improvements in Egypt Suggest a Campaign to Undermine Morsi
description: CAIRO  The streets seethe with protests and government ministers are on the run or in jail, but since the military ousted President Mohamed Morsi, life has somehow gotten better for many people across Egypt: Gas lines have disappeared, power cuts have stopped and the police have returned to the street.

title: Democrats Shrug Off Delays and Affirm Support for Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional Democrats said Wednesday that they expected to see more delays and snags in President Obamas efforts to carry out the new health care law, but they affirmed their strong support for the overarching goal of expanded coverage.

title: Differences on Cybertheft Complicate China Talks
description: WASHINGTON  Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. opened annual strategic talks with senior Chinese leaders here on Wednesday by repeating the United States accusation that the electronic theft of American intellectual property could undermine the relationship between the worlds two largest economies.

title: A Free Miracle Food!
description: MOPTI, Mali  Can you name a miracle food that is universally available, free and can save childrens lives and maybe even make them smarter?

title: To Save Egypt, Drop the Presidency
description: NEW HAVEN  AS violence escalates, Egypts military is trying to bridge a widening political gap by promising a rapid return to civilian rule. But its gesture of accommodation does not get to the heart of the problem: the presidential system, inherited from the Mubarak era, virtually guarantees a repetition of the tragic events of the past year. A democratic breakthrough requires a more fundamental constitutional redesign, in which the contending sides compete for power in a European-style parliamentary system.

title: The Cost of Compromise
description: In his 2011 memoir, Five Chiefs, the retired Supreme Court Justice John Paul Stevens offered a mildly eyebrow-raising reflection on Brown v. Board of Education. The landmark school desegregation decision is celebrated not only for its outcome but also for the unanimity that Chief Justice Earl Warren extracted from his wary colleagues. But the price of unanimity may have been too high, Justice Stevens suggested. He observed that the courts compromise order to desegregate with all deliberate speed, rather than immediately, turned into a recipe for hardly any speed at all.

title: Beyond the Courtroom
description: Whatever happens in the George Zimmerman trial, it has produced a valuable and profound dialogue in America about some important issues surrounding race and justice, fear and aggression, and legal guilt and moral culpability.

title: Broken Promises
description: WASHINGTON  WHEN I retired in 2011 after serving 30 years in Congress, there was one set of issues I knew I could not leave behind. I donated $1 million of unused campaign funds to create the Center for Native American Youth at the Aspen Institute, because our country has left a trail of broken promises to American Indians.

title: Hagel Warns of Impact of Cutbacks on Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel offered Congress his first formal description of the impact on the Pentagon if across-the-board budget cuts are not lifted by October, writing in a letter on Wednesday that the effectiveness of jet fighter wings, ground combat units and even Special Operations forces would plummet.

title: Coping With Wifes Death, a Ranger Is Returning to the Ice
description: Dominic Moore took last season off to care for his wife, Katie, who had a rare form of liver cancer and died in January. On Wednesday, Moore spoke with reporters for the first time since signing with the Rangers last week, describing his ordeal of the last several months.

title: New York Sizzles
description: Positive aspects of New York Citys Weiner-Spitzer summer:

title: Abusing Nomination Votes to Change Policy
description: President Obamas nominee for chairman of the Export-Import Bank, a provider of export financing, could become the latest casualty of a right-wing effort to derail agencies by refusing to confirm appointees to run them.

title: Clouds Darken Over Egypt
description: The military proved disastrously inept when it tried to govern Egypt after the overthrow of Hosni Mubarak in 2011. Now, a week after ousting Mohamed Morsi, the first freely elected president, the military is orchestrating an even more dangerous maneuver. We are deeply fearful that Egypt could devolve into civil war, which would add new trauma to a region already in turmoil.

title: Luxembourg Spy Scandal Forces Exit of Premier
description: BRUSSELS  The longest-serving government leader in the European Union, Jean-Claude Juncker of Luxembourg, bowed Wednesday to outrage over revelations of a litany of abuses by his tiny countrys wayward intelligence service and declared that he would step down as prime minister.

title: One Drop in Military Sexual Violence
description: The Navy is reporting surprising success in a program to get sailors at Naval Station Great Lakes, near Chicago, to stop raping their comrades. Sexual assaults have been epidemic at the station, where about 40,000 recruits complete boot camp each year. But crimes at the stations Training Support Center, where about 16,000 sailors receive specialized training, and where most of the assaults occur, have fallen about 60 percent over two years.

title: Youve Been Warned
description: With two bad rules adopted on Wednesday, the Securities and Exchange Commission has all but invited hucksters, rip-off artists and other bad actors to prey on individual investors. The new rules are another disturbing sign that under the leadership of the new chairwoman, Mary Jo White, the S.E.C. will pursue deregulation at the expense of investor protection.

title: To Catch a Creditor
description: IN 1999, Judy Ann Thomas of Elyria, Ohio, applied for a loan. But the bank mixed up her record with the file of a Utah woman named Judith Kendall  their Social Security numbers have seven digits in common. Because Ms. Kendall had a poor credit score, Ms. Thomas didnt get the loan.

title: N.Y.U. Impeding Compensation Inquiry, Senator Says
description: Four months after Senator Charles E. Grassley began an inquiry into New York Universitys executive compensation practices, it still has not provided crucial information he requested, he said on Wednesday.

title: E-Book Ruling Gives Amazon an Advantage
description: Jeff Bezos, the founder of Amazon, loves disrupting markets. In that regard, he must be having a delightful summer. The book business, once so mired in the past it seemed part of the antiques trade, is up for grabs.

title: Twisting Path Put Rockets in Position to Sign Howard
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The transaction is simple on the surface, familiar and mathematically sound. An N.B.A. team creates salary-cap room. An N.B.A. star signs a rich deal using that room. The Houston Rockets sign Dwight Howard and become instant contenders.

title: The Decline of Black Power in the South
description: To understand the depth of the damage that the Supreme Courts June 25 decision, Shelby County v. Holder, has inflicted on the voting rights of African-Americans, you have to measure it against the backdrop of the takeover of state legislatures, primarily in the South, by the Republican Party.

title: A Dissident Goes Global
description: The Chinese dissident Chen Guangcheng has become a celebrity and a headache for the Chinese authorities.

title: Republicans in House Resist Overhaul for Immigration
description: WASHINGTON  Meeting for the first time as a group to hash out their approach to immigration, House Republicans on Wednesday came down overwhelmingly against a comprehensive overhaul of the nations immigration laws, putting in jeopardy the future of sweeping legislation that includes a path to citizenship for undocumented immigrants.

title: After Epic Escape From China, Exile Is Mired in Partisan U.S.
description: Chen Guangcheng, the blind legal advocate who challenged the Chinese government over its harsh family planning policies, is nothing if not a politically astute survivor. He outsmarted the phalanx of guards who kept him under house arrest and then made his way into the American Embassy, setting off a diplomatic crisis that was resolved only after Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton intervened and negotiated his freedom.

title: Summertime and the Reading Is Easy
In Flight: The Golden Age, and Now
description: To the Editor:

title: Europe and U.S. Spying
description: To the Editor:

title: Weighing a Quicker Exit From Afghanistan
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Stand on Egypt
description: To the Editor:

title: Leland Mitchell, Who Defied Racism on the Basketball Court, Dies at 72
description: In 1963, Leland Mitchell and his Mississippi State teammates had to sneak out of their state to compete in the N.C.A.A. basketball tournament. Gov. Ross Barnett and other hard-core segregationists were worried that their all-white team might compete against blacks, a step the governor said he feared might lead to integration across the land.

title: On Jet Skis, Chasing Waves in Pursuit of Freedom
description: The call to ride went out before dawn.

title: Corrections: July 11, 2013
description: NATIONAL

title: Saving a Life in Record Time
description: Erin Luhmann, this years win-a-trip winner, writes a post from Mali about a surprisingly quick fix for life-threatening malnourishment in children.

title: Let Off the Hook
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Ill tell you how much I like Henry Hooks puzzles, although he would probably deride me for being a fangirl. I like his puzzles so much that I am willing to let him off the hook, so to speak, for what seems to me to be a relatively meh theme.

title: Deal Reached to Rein In Overseas Trading
description: 9:40 a.m., July 11 | Updated

title: Anton Antonov-Ovseyenko, Who Exposed Stalin Terror, Dies at 93
description: It is the duty of every honest person to write the truth about Stalin, Anton Antonov-Ovseyenko, a Soviet historian and dissident, wrote in the preface of his seminal book, The Time of Stalin: Portrait of a Tyranny, published illegally in 1981.

title: Marylands Path to an Accord in Abortion Fight
description: BALTIMORE  The 18-year-old woman arrived at Johns Hopkins Hospital by medevac helicopter in critical condition. Her uterus and bowel had been pierced during a late-term abortion that had started in New Jersey and ended at an unmarked, unregulated clinic in Elkton, in northeastern Maryland.

title: After Bargnani Trade, Woodson Sees Big Man as Big Plus for Knicks
description: LAS VEGAS  The Knicks owe Amare Stoudemire $21.7 million next season. The cost per minute might be extraordinary.

title: Guide to a Few Nonprofit Groups Providing Care to Veterans
description: Over the next several years, the United States government estimates, one million veterans will leave active-duty military service. Many will need health care or disability compensation. All will go through a process of learning to be civilians again, an often-difficult process.

title: Finding Thrills on the Waves of New York
description: A day out with the Jetty Jumpers, a group of Jet Ski riders from Brooklyn, who soar over the waves around New York City.

title: Nova Makes It Two Dominating Starts in a Row
description: Ivan Nova was coming off perhaps the game of his life. Last week, with his future in the Yankees rotation less than certain, he pitched a complete game and struck out 11 Baltimore Orioles in a spot start. He had earned another start, another chance to prove himself, which came Wednesday night against the Kansas City Royals.

title: 2 Competitors Sued by Genetics Company for Patent Infringement
description: Myriad Genetics is suing competitors that have begun to offer genetic testing for breast cancer risk after the Supreme Courts ruling last month that human genes cannot be patented.

title: Poll Shows Complexity of Debate on Trade-Offs in Government Spying Programs
description: WASHINGTON  When Edward J. Snowden risked prison to go public with classified documents about National Security Agency surveillance, he said he wanted to give the public a chance to weigh in on what he considered an excessive intrusion on the privacy of Americans.

title: Madams Ties to Spitzer? Its a Campaign Issue
description: She is a madam, but was she his madam?

title: Police Practices Take Center Stage at G.O.P. Mayoral Debate
description: Facing off in a televised debate on Wednesday, the leading Republican candidates for mayor vowed to fully support the Police Department and to limit the role of an inspector general that would monitor the department.

title: Video of Railway Head Blaming Fiery Crash in Quebec on Train Employee
description: As my colleague Ian Austen reports, the head of the railway company told reporters Monday during his first visit to Lac-Megantic in Quebec that an employee failed to properly set the brakes on the oil-filled train that exploded when it crashed into the town early Saturday. At least 20 people are confirmed dead. The police also said that 30 more people were still missing, and it is widely assumed that they are dead.

title: Britain Offers Its Proposal to Privatize Mail Service
description: LONDON  The British government said on Wednesday that it planned to sell a majority stake in Royal Mail, the countrys postal service, and would give some shares free to workers.

title: In 2011 Murder Inquiry, Hints of Missed Chance to Avert Boston Bombing
description: WALTHAM, Mass.  It was the most brazen crime in the memory of this Boston suburb: three men murdered with knife slashes to their throats in a second-floor apartment at 12 Harding Avenue; each corpse precisely positioned, stomach down, head turned a quarter to the right, marijuana sprinkled on top.

title: Young, Rich and Relocating Yet Again in Hunt for Political Office
description: SHOKAN, N.Y.  This is the story of how one young couple came to the Hudson Valley with a fortune and big political dreams.

title: Lottery Numbers
Soldiers Lawyers Rest Case With a Defense of WikiLeaks Journalistic Role
description: FORT MEADE, Md.  The defense in the court-martial of Pfc. Bradley Manning rested its case Wednesday with a Harvard law professor testifying that WikiLeaks performed a legitimate journalistic function when Private Manning gave it vast archives of secret government files.

title: Honoring Humanities and Arts in the Capital
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama awarded the nations highest honors in the arts and humanities on Wednesday to two dozen people  among them Joan Didion, Tony Kushner, George Lucas and Elaine May  whose work, he said, represented a lasting contribution to American life.

title: Illinois: Lawmakers May Miss Payday
description: Gov. Pat Quinn suspended lawmakers paychecks Wednesday, saying they did not deserve compensation until the states escalating pension crisis was solved. The move came a day after the General Assembly ignored a deadline Mr. Quinn set to pass a bill addressing the states $100 billion in unfunded pension liability. The governors line-item veto of a state budget measure withholds legislators $67,836 salaries, as well as additional stipends for those in leadership positions. They must have that alarm bell ringing in their ears, Mr. Quinn said at a news conference. And the best way to do that is to hit them in their wallet. Judy Baar Topinka, the Illinois comptroller, said a legal review of the decision would be completed before lawmakers were scheduled to receive their next paychecks on Aug. 1.

title: In Health-Conscious Denver, Limits on Group Exercise
description: DENVER  The Saturday morning workout crew had survived a grueling round of push-ups and sprints, crunches and lunges under a broiling sun in the heart of the gentrifying downtown here. But as they got ready for the days sweaty coup de grce  balancing acrobatically on their hands  they were alerted that their exercise routine had run afoul of the rules.

title: Air Pollution May Raise Appendicitis Risk
description: Air pollution slightly increases the risk for appendicitis, according to a new report.

title: A Call to Battle on Bank Leverage
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Doctors Badmouthing Other Doctors
description: A physician friend known for her conscientious work recently disclosed that a year ago she was named in a malpractice lawsuit. The revelation rattled me not only because there were no discernible errors in the care she provided, but also because I couldnt believe who had provoked the patient to hire a lawyer.

title: Climate Change Will Cause More Energy Breakdowns, U.S. Warns
description: WASHINGTON  The nations entire energy system is vulnerable to increasingly severe and costly weather events driven by climate change, according to a report from the Department of Energy to be published on Thursday.

title: Word of the Day | drone
description: drone \dron\ noun and verb

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, July 11, 2013
description: Today, having an abortion is safer than an injection of penicillin.

title: Whats On Thursday
description: 8 P.M. (USA) SUMMER CAMP In this new reality series 16 men and women head to a lakeside retreat in California to relive their childhoods through contests inspired by classic camp games. They split into two teams to compete (above), and the losers of the weekly challenge must banish two of their members to the other side. The opponents will then decide which of the two must leave the competition. At the end of the summer the remaining contestants will face off in an Olympic-style campathalon, with the winners receiving $250,000 to divide among the contenders. Matt Rogers hosts. In Burn Notice, at 9, Michael (Jeffrey Donovan) and a former Russian operative team up to escape Cuba. And in Graceland, at 10, Mike (Aaron Tveit) further infiltrates the organization of Bello (Gbenga Akinnagbe), while Briggs (Daniel Sunjata) and Charlie (Vanessa Ferlito) pose as lovers to investigate a drug supplier.

title: San Francisco Air Crash Emergency Calls Released
description: Updated | Thursday, 10: 10 a.m. Emergency calls from those who witnessed the crash of a Boeing 777 at San Francisco International Airport on Saturday, and those who were aboard the plane, emerged late Wednesday, released by the California Highway Patrol, according to reports.

title: News Quiz | July 11, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: U.N. Secretary General Warns Myanmar on Religious Violence
description: BANGKOK  The secretary general of the United Nations, Ban Ki-moon, warned the Myanmar government on Wednesday of dangerous polarization between Buddhists and Muslims and urged the leaders of the Buddhist-majority country to resolve the question of citizenship for the nearly one million stateless Muslims near the border with Bangladesh.

title: Poverty Benefit Concert Set for Central Park
description: For a second year in a row, the Global Poverty Project is mounting a benefit concert in Central Park, on Sept. 28, to urge world leaders at the United Nations to do more to raise the living standards among the worlds poor. This time the show will feature Alicia Keys, Kings of Leon, John Mayer and Stevie Wonder.

title: Verdict on Juvenile Accused in Delhi Gang Rape Deferred
description: NEW DELHI  Seven months after six men, including a teenager, allegedly carried out an assault and rape that led to the death of a 23-year-old paramedical student on Dec. 16, the Juvenile Justice Board in Delhi has deferred its verdict against the youngest of the accused till July 25. A magistrate at the Juvenile Justice Board was expected to declare the judgement today, but has delayed the verdict against the accused who was 17 at the time of the crime.

title: Japans Economy on Road to Recovery, Central Bank Says
description: TOKYO  Three months into Japans bid to reinflate its economy after years of falling prices, the countrys central bank said on Thursday that economic conditions were starting to recover, signaling its confidence that the worlds third-largest economy was on the cusp of a long-awaited turnaround.

title: Test Yourself | English, July 11, 2013
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article Unarrested Development.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Paying Tribute to a Diplomat Who Saved Thousands from Nazi Persecution
description: In the article, In Portugal, a Protector of a People Is Honored, Raphael Minder writes about an effort to honor a diplomat who saved thousands from Nazi persecution.

title: Golf in China Is Younger Than Tiger Woods, but Growing Up Fast
description: Xie Chengfeng had a fever. Otherwise, the Chinese golfer would have been driving his orange coupe to the practice range on this June morning rather than languishing in bed, cold towel on his forehead, in his four-story mansion. Five years ago, Xie (pronounced shee-eh) and his family uprooted themselves and moved to Mission Hills, a sprawling golf resort in the southern Chinese city of Shenzhen for just one purpose: so he could become the next Tiger Woods.

title: Preppy Drinks Never Go Out of Style
description: I pored over The Official Preppy Handbook for innumerable hours when it came out in 1980. Some of its jokes were lost on me, but I loved the detailed, annotated illustrations. It was like an intro anthro class: these were not my people, and I was as fascinated by them as I would be years later by the Yanomami.

title: On a Trapeze, Reaching for an Elusive Dream
description: Christian Rodriguez has pictures of upside-down people  and upside-down elephants  in his series on the seemingly glamorous occupation of being a circus artist.

title: Go East, Old Man: Mired in the Primordial Ooze
description: Dexter Ford is traveling from Southern California to upstate New York along mostly obscure roads, on a motorcycle that, by American standards, is quite tiny. This is the first of his occasional reports from the paths less traveled.

title: New York Today: Ballot Fever
description: Updated, 12:22 p.m. | Thursdays forecast calls for a deluge of campaign workers.

title: Q&A: Revealing Your Location (or Not) to Mobile Apps
description: Q.

title: Unraveling the Pollinating Secrets of a Bees Buzz

title: Monsters, Machines and Mind Melding in a Race for the World
description: Viewed from one angle  from below, say, as you cower before the Imax screen, your 3-D glasses digging into the bridge of your nose, condensation from your Diet Coke dripping onto your leg  Pacific Rim looks a lot like other movies of its type. Dinosaurish creatures as big as skyscrapers do battle with equally gigantic robots on land and sea, pulverizing familiar cities and churning up geysers of spume. Human characters (some of whom are actually inside the giant robots) bark out catchphrases, spout fake science and express noble sentiments as they fight to save the planet. More than two hours of your life elapse before they do.

title: Thursday Reading: How Faith Can Affect Therapy
An Accord on Regulating Overseas Trading

The potential deal, subject to final approval by the agency, would be reached with hours to spare before a deadline on Friday, according to people briefed on the matter.

title: Dead Lawyer, a Kremlin Critic, Is Found Guilty of Tax Evasion

As the judge, his voice nearly inaudible, read out his verdict, one of the main defense lawyers paid no attention, tapping nonchalantly on his tablet computer instead.

title: Microsoft Overhauls, the Apple Way

The chart for Microsoft showed several isolated pyramids representing its divisions, each with a cartoon pistol aimed at the other.

title: Humanities and the Intellect
description: Regarding Resilience of the humanities (July 5): Scott Saul states that, Many of our students struggle to think and write with precision, and we struggle to teach them the mechanics of good writing. I respectfully suggest that any educational institution at the post-high school/university level in any country should emphasize the importance of the humanities in terms of expanding a students intellect, by reference to the study of philosophy in particular, and the application of philosophical methods to any academic discipline, be it the study of medicine or law or business, indeed any faculty that requires critical and analytical thinking and the forensic critique of information. Perhaps such an approach would be helpful to students, and also assist educators in their attempts to successfully teach students how to think and write with precision?

title: House Republicans Push Through Farm Bill, Without Food Stamps
description: WASHINGTON  Republicans muscled a pared-back agriculture bill through the House on Thursday, stripping out the food stamp program to satisfy recalcitrant conservatives but losing what little Democratic support the bill had when it failed last month. It was the first time food stamps had not been a part of the farm bill since 1973.

title: Bumi Chairman Agrees to Buy Out Bakrie Family

description: When the results of the new small overlap crash tests conducted by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety on 13 compact crossovers and S.U.V.s were released in May, the group said the new 2013 Toyota RAV4 was missing from the tests because the automaker wanted time to make improvements.

description: Derek Jeter waited more than eight months to get back in a game and push aside the jarring image from last October, when he lay on the infield dirt at Yankee Stadium, his left ankle fractured. During that long stretch, Jeter endured the rehabilitation from the first surgery, a second fracture in the same ankle, and more months of rehab work.

title: Elizabeth Duke, Fed Governor, Plans to Step Down
description: WASHINGTON  Elizabeth A. Duke, a Federal Reserve governor who has helped to overhaul the Feds approach to financial regulation, said on Thursday that she would step down at the end of August.

title: London Theater Journal: Monsters and Ghosts
description: LONDON  Kim Cattrall has one great movie-star moment toward the end of Sweet Bird of Youth at the Old Vic Theater. Before the moment it arrived, I was worried that there would be nothing worth remembering from Marianne Elliotts turgid revival of Tennessee Williamss overwrought 1959 play about time as an assassin of the young and beautiful. So, thank you, Ms. Cattrall and Ms. Elliott, for salving my disappointment  at one of my final shows on this trip to London  at the last minute with this single image, fit for Cinemascope-sized recollection.

description: BATH, England  Mention Laura Ashley to a woman of a certain age, and the immediate response is a wistful smile and a nostalgic story about a soft, ruffled cotton dress and a special summer evening or unforgettable party.

description: There have been some big shifts in e-books lately.

description: The PEN American Center today announced the shortlists and judges for its 2013 PEN Literary Awards. Taken together, the awards, fellowships and grants from the literary and human rights organization will confer $150,000 on writers, editors and translators.

title: Cost Estimate Puts in Doubt Deal Covering Student Loans

description: Sometimes sessions with my oncologist resemble meetings with a therapist. Why am I entranced with a woman who continues to prescribe procedures that distress me? The attraction was instantaneous, maybe because I had been so dismayed by her predecessor.

title: In Closing, Zimmerman Prosecutor Focuses on Inconsistencies
description: SANFORD, Fla.  In a murder case of chain reactions, the chief prosecutor, Bernie de la Rionda, began with the very first link when he delivered his closing statement on Thursday in the George Zimmerman trial.

title: As Labor Dispute Drags On, Minnesota Orchestra Cancels Summer Concerts
description: The intractable labor dispute at the Minnesota Orchestra, where the musicians have been locked out since October, had already caused the cancellation of the respected orchestras entire 2012-13 season and has now wiped out its planned summer season as well.

title: 50 Years Later, a Break in a Boston Strangler Case
description: BOSTON  Investigators said Thursday that they had linked the man believed by many to have been the Boston Strangler to DNA found in the home of a woman thought to be the Stranglers last victim in a string of unsolved murders that petrified this city in the early 1960s and has perplexed it ever since.

title: Philip Caldwell, First Nonfamily Member to Head Ford, Is Dead at 93
description: Philip Caldwell, the button-down manager chosen over Lee A. Iacocca to become the first head of the Ford Motor Company who was not a member of the Ford family, died on Wednesday at his home in New Canaan, Conn. He was 93.

title: Video, Yes; High-Def, No
description: Andrew Bujalski likes it vintage. He has been making small, talky 16-millimeter films for the past decade, even as the industry has become progressively more digital. Over the years, Mr. Bujalski was asked why he hadnt joined much of the indie world in shooting his movies on digital video. This contrarian responded with his latest feature, Computer Chess, which is about as video as video gets, but not in the way his questioners may have had in mind.

title: Layhmond Robinson Jr., Who Paved Way for Black Journalists, Dies at 88
description: Layhmond Robinson Jr., one of the first black reporters at The New York Times, who later became a local television news correspondent, died on June 29 in Queens. He was 88.

title: William Morris to Invest in Droga5, an Ad Agency
description: William Morris Endeavor, the giant talent agency, is close to acquiring a significant minority stake in Droga5, an independent advertising agency based in New York. The deal, which is estimated at $225 million, is expected to be completed early next week.

title: Introducing the New TimesMachine
description: We are very pleased to offer a preview of our TimesMachine redesign. Our subscribers can, for the first time, read complete issues of The New York Times in their original context. For each issue that is available in the new TimesMachine, every article, every letter and every advertisement is included in a legible, linkable and shareable fashion.

description: The coming All-Star break could not come at a better time for baseball. For the ruling cabal, its corporate-sponsored bacchanalia cannot come often enough, particularly with that nasty Biogenesis scandal percolating in the background and Alex Rodriguez still trying to swing a bat somewhere (in Tampa, in, ahem, rehab). But even the rest of us need a chance to stop and look around. After all, the first half has been downright disorienting.

title: Hollands Plan for Americas Slaves
description: In 1863, American blacks were not the only enslaved people with emancipation on the mind. On the northeastern coast of South America, in the Dutch colony of Suriname, some 30,000 slaves also prepared for their day of freedom, which would arrive with the governments emancipation mandate of July 1, 1863, six months after Lincoln issued the Emancipation Proclamation.

title: In Store | Montauks New One-Stop Lifestyle Shop
description: Ive always wanted to do a little hotel store with cool things that you need and things you didnt know you need, explained Lori Leven of her latest venture, Love Adorned: Summer Session, a pop-up shop at Ruschmeyers, the summer-camp-like hotel in Montauk, N.Y. While shed flirted with the idea of opening a location of Love Adorned, her thoughtfully curated jewelry and lifestyle shop, on the eastern tip of Long Island for a while, Leven admitted that the spot posed challenges she hadnt faced at her Amagansett or Manhattan locations  namely, finding a way to secure the merchandise when the shop was closed but the lobby was still bustling. We came up with the idea of making cabinets reminiscent of old train cases that we could completely close down and lock at night and easily open to reveal the goods in the morning, she said. Those goods run the gamut from basic necessities (toothpaste and Tylenol) to RTH sweatshirts, leather bandannas from Japan, childrens moccasins, one-of-a-kind vintage objects like compasses and hand-carved penknives, and, of course, jewelry.

title: Egypt Calls for New Look at Morsi Prison Escape in 2011
description: CAIRO  Egypts new rulers gave new credence to a court case against the ousted president, Mohamed Morsi, and members of the Muslim Brotherhood on Thursday over their escape from prison during the uprising that toppled his predecessor, Hosni Mubarak.

title: Far-Off Quakes May Cause Temblors at Injection Wells
description: Researchers have known for years that disposing of waste water from oil and gas production by injecting it into deep wells can lead to earthquakes. Now scientists at Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory, a part of Columbia University, have discovered the actual trigger for some of those quakes: the passing seismic waves from much larger, far-off earthquakes.

description: An explosion caused by the improper use of an insecticide ripped through a beauty parlor in Chinatown on Thursday afternoon, causing a partial collapse of the building and a fire, and injuring eight occupants, three of them critically, the authorities said.

title: Help the Frugal Traveler Explore the Heartland
description: Its an American travel staple: the cross-country road trip. Weeks behind the wheel, heading down highways and rural roads, holing up in motels, pulling into roadside diners, breezing through small towns, taking big cities by storm and, I hope, getting to know this great nation of ours in a way the National Security Agency could only dream of.

title: In a Town of Hunters, a Maligned Man Falls Prey to Malice
description: In The Hunt, Lucas (Mads Mikkelsen), a disgraced kindergarten teacher suspected of being a pedophile, confronts his former best friend Theo (Thomas Bo Larsen) in a church on Christmas Day. Look in my eyes, he says to Theo. What do you see? Lucas navely believes that his true nature will reveal itself: in this case, his innocence.

title: Small Books With Big Souls
description: In poetry, small is often most beautiful: The poignant four-line lyric that bears more emotional weight than an entire novel. Ancient Chinese and Japanese poems that transcend centuries and cultures. And the poetry bungalows  not near large enough to be called publishing houses  that quietly make small-seeming books full of big-souled poems.

title: To See America, Be a Traveler, Not a Tourist
description: The road book has a long and glorious history in the annals of literature, starting perhaps with The Odyssey (assuming youre willing to consider the sea as a road). One of the newest entrants in the genre is The Longest Road: Overland in Search of America, From Key West to the Arctic Ocean by Philip Caputo (Holt). Mr. Caputo is a Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist and the author of A Rumor of War, a memoir of the Vietnam War. His new book chronicles his trip in an Airstream trailer from one corner of North America to the other.

title: Mandelas Kin Face Gray Area on End of Life
description: JOHANNESBURG  The family of Nelson Mandela, who has been lying at the edge of death in a South African hospital for more than a month, might in the days or weeks to come face the same awful decision that has confronted numerous other families in an age of life-sustaining miracle machines: when is it time to say enough.

title: As G.O.P. Guts Energy Research Spending, Wheres George Will, Science Defender?
description: Some readers may recall that in 2011 I credited the conservative columnist George Will  someone Ive mostly sparred with  for warning the new Republican majority in the House not to weaken governments role in pursuing basic science.

description: Just because there is no sign of actual governing arising from Congress, it doesnt mean that the right-wing dominated House Republican Caucus is just sitting around doing nothing. To the contrary, in addition to plotting the demise of the first real chance at immigration reform in decades, House G.O.P. leaders are thinking of new ways to continue their long-running show of trying to stop health care reform from taking effect.

title: Big Payout by Moelis May Whet the Appetite for More
description: Moelis & Companys $35 million payout to its mainly staff owners shows the partnership model in investment banking can deliver. description: If youre even just a little weary of the well-made, no-risk, eye-on-fashion fare in so many Manhattan summer group shows, consider a trip to the Bronx Museum of the Arts, where the exhibition State of Mind: New California Art Circa 1970 has breezed in from the West Coast, bringing with it a tonic of gawky rawness and moral purpose.
